title: I want to publish a novel that I've spent a little over six months writing. What do I do next? - Quora

response.answer_text: Since you didn't mention trying to get an agent or an editor at a publishing house, I'm assuming you want to self publish.  This article should answer all of your questions.   Self-publishing a book: 25 things you need to know - CNET  By the way, six months is not a lot of time to produce fresh, quality writing.  Be sure to have your work evaluated and edited.  Nothing kills a writing reputation faster than a book full of typos and grammatical errors.  Be sure you have your plot points in place, keep your pacing up, throw in a twist or two, write compelling and interesting characters, keep your POV consistent, have a killer opening hook and a satisfying ending, tie up all loose ends, check for 'telling and not showing', get rid of all exclamation points, be sure your dialogue is engaging and moves the story forward, limit your narration, and choose a catchy title.

You heard it all. Get an editor first. Publish on Amazon for free to Kindle. You need to have easy access for reviewers, because this is your next job - find reviewers. This will take longer than writing your book. You need to built your audience on all social networks as well. Nobody will find your book on Amazon unless you send people there! Good luck! Amazon.com: Werner Stejskal: Books, Biography
